raw_text:
McClaren targets Champions League
 
 Middlesbrough boss Steve McClaren believes his side can clinch a top-four spot in the Premiership and secure qualification for the Champions League.
 
 After their 3-2 win over Manchester City, McClaren said: "We are playing exciting football, it's a magnificent result to keep us in the top five. "But how well we do depends how often we can get our best team out. "Once we got the third goal it should have been four or five but we nearly paid for it in the end." McClaren also praised winger Stewart Downing and strikers Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka, who both ended barren runs in front of goal. He added: "If Stewart keeps playing like this Sven-Goran Eriksson has got to pick him. "And the strikers scored great goals, the combination play between them shows they want to play with each other and they are trying."
llama3.2:1b: Steve McClaren believes Middlesbrough can secure top-four spot in the Premiership and Champions League qualification by playing exciting football and maintaining a high-performing team.
llama3.2:3b: Steve McClaren believes Middlesbrough can finish top four in Premiership and qualify for Champions League after 3-2 win over Manchester City.
gemma2:2b:
Steve McClaren believes Middlesbrough can secure a Champions League spot in the Premier League.  He praised his team's performance against Manchester City, stating that consistency will be key to achieving their goal. 
McClaren acknowledged the importance of getting their best lineup on the field and expressed excitement about Stewart Downing's performance, as well as Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka's goals.  He believes this combination play highlights a desire from the strikers to work together.

smollm:1.7b:
Manchester City's 3-2 win over Middlesbrough is a significant achievement that can help secure qualification for the Champions League. The team's ability to maintain their top five finish in the Premiership, despite not winning the league title last season, demonstrates their consistency and competitiveness. McClaren believes his side has the potential to clinch a top-four spot in the Premiership and secure qualification for the Champions League.

After their 3-2 win over Manchester City, McClaren said: "We are playing exciting football, it's a magnificent result to keep us in the top five." He praised winger Stewart Downing and striker Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka, who both ended barren runs in front of goal. McClaren also acknowledged the efforts of striker Sven-Goran Eriksson, who scored great goals for Middlesbrough. He added: "If Stewart keeps playing like this Sven-Goran Eriksson has got to pick him."

McClaren believes that if Stewart continues to play at his best, he can secure a top-four finish in the Premiership and qualify for the Champions League. The team's ability to maintain their top five finish last season demonstrates their consistency and competitiveness. McClaren also praised the strikers' performances, saying they have shown they are willing to work together and score goals with each other.

Overall, McClaren believes his side has the potential to clinch a top-four spot in the Premiership and secure qualification for the Champions League. The team's ability to maintain their top five finish last season demonstrates their consistency and competitiveness, while the strikers' performances highlight their willingness to work together and score goals with each other.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Steve McClaren's team, Middlesbrough, targeting the Champions League. Let me read through it carefully.

The main points seem to be:

1. Steve McClaren is Middlesbrough's boss.
2. He believes his team can get into the top-four of the Premiership and qualify for the Champions League.
3. They scored a 3-2 win over Manchester City.
4. After that win, he mentioned that getting the third goal was challenging because they nearly paid for it, which probably indicates their struggle against Manchester City.
5. He praised some key players like Winger Stewart Downing and strikers Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka. He even mentioned Sven-Goran Eriksson if Stewart continues to play well.
6. The strikers managed a great goalkeeping combination, showing they're focused on playing together.

I need to make sure I include all these key ideas without getting too detailed or omitting any important details from the original text. Also, since the output should be plain text with only the summary, no explanations or formatting, just concise information.
</think>

Steve McClaren is Middlesbrough's boss and believes his team can secure a top-four spot in the Premiership to qualify for the Champions League. After a 3-2 win over Manchester City, McClaren highlighted the excitement of their game but stressed how difficult it was for them to keep up against Manchester City. He praised key players, including Winger Stewart Downing, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, and Mark Viduka, who showed resilience despite barren runs. The strikers managed a goalkeeping combo that suggested they are focused on team play together.
tinyllama:1.1b: McClaren sees top-four spot at stake in Premier League, qualification for Champions League in focus following 3-2 win over Manchester City. After the victory, McClaren believes his side can still secure qualification and reach the elite club competition. He also praised midfielders Stewart Downing, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, and Mark Viduka, who scored great goals. Despite the three points, McClaren highlights the need to maintain the balance between scoring goals and creating opportunities for others.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Boss Steve McClaren is confident his team can clinch a top-four spot in the Premier League and qualify for the Champions League. After securing a crucial win over Manchester City, McClaren believes the team has the right mix of players to reach the desired level. The key player in this statement is winger Stewart Downing who has been on a hot streak, scoring multiple goals and proving his worth as a top talent in the league. Additionally, strikers Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka have all contributed meaningful goals to propel their team forward. McClaren acknowledges that if one of these talented players is not playing at his best, the team might face difficulties in maintaining their momentum. It's clear that Steve McClaren sees great potential on the field and is confident that his team can accomplish its goals.
phi:2.7b: Steve McClaren believes Middlesbrough can secure a top-four spot in Premiership and qualify for Champions League after winning 3-2 against Manchester City. He praises the team's attacking play and singled out strikers Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink and Mark Viduka, who scored great goals. Downing also played exceptionally well.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Middlesbrough's manager, Steve McClaren, is optimistic about his team's potential to secure a top-four Premiership finish and Champions League qualification. Following their 3-2 victory over Manchester City, McClaren emphasized the team's dynamic play and the importance of consistent selection of his best players. He singled out winger Stewart Downing, strikers Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, and Mark Viduka for their recent goal-scoring form after extended goalless streaks.
